title: Cannot download league for Windows 10, tried almost everything and still won't work?? Visual C++prob
body: So I bought a new HP laptop just because I was extremely excited to start playing League on my own laptop now right? However, during the installation process, it mentions that there's a Visual C++ 2005 Redistributable (x64) problem. I'm not exactly a computer genius and don't know what that means exactly, however I'm smart enough to atleast work my way around the basic details? I've tried searching so many websites for answers and watched so many different kinds of youtube videos on how to fix the problem, but no matter what I try, it only mentions the Visual C++ problem... and I tried to download the Visual C++ 2005 Redistributable (x64) on the windows but for some reason it wont let me?? I figured that would've solved my problem but now I'm still stuck?! I just want to play League asap!! SOMEONE PLEASE HELP!!!

replies.body: there can actually be a lot of problems with window 10 and LoL mine just happened to be that my firewall was blocking it once i turned it off it downloaded and played fine, have you tried switching your settings to run as windows 7 before downloading? i heard that helps, let me know if i can be of help, ill do my best!
Thank you for your support! But I've already got the problem figured out now!

This Visual C++ installation error can typically be resolved by first ensuring all windows updates are installed. After that, [uninstall](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/instantanswers/ce7ba88b-4e95-4354-b807-35732db36c4d/repair-or-remove-programs) all current versions of C++ 2005 on your PC, then install a fresh copy [from here](http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=3387).

Let me know if this helped.
Thanks a lot! That helped, I just clicked your link from "install a fresh copy from here." and I guess it downloaded what I needed! The game is finally installing now atleast!! Thank you so much!
